H2450.def: = state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency

H1.def: = direct male progenitor; ► who normally provides protection, care, instruction, and discipline; ≈ is usually regarded with respect and associated with wisdom, security, and comfort

H4148.def: = causative action by which deities offer primarily verbal instruction to humans, which may occasionally be accompanied by physical punishment, given as a result of misbehavior or to prevent misbehavior, ► aimed to teach the receiver (and sometimes other people as well) wisdom and good behavior

H3887.def: = someone who shows contempt for other people and ideas

H1606.def: = action by which humans or deities speak to animals, humans, deities, or natural objects in anger, in order to express their displeasure and cause them to change their behavior

H6529.def: = produce from crop-bearing trees and plants

H398.def: = action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object

H5315.def: = the part of the body connecting the head to the rest of the body and containing the passageways for blood, air, and food; ≈ associated with breathing, appetite, and life and often used metonymically to refer to the entire body and the personality inhabiting it

H898.def: = pattern of behavior by which humans act in a way which shows a lack of truthfulness and commitment, both in words and deeds

H2555.def: = pattern of behavior by which humans behave aggressively towards other humans, ► usually in order to enrich oneself in one way or another

H5341.def: = action by which humans or deities carefully observe an object or event for a longer period of time

H5315.def: = the part of the body connecting the head to the rest of the body and containing the passageways for blood, air, and food; ≈ associated with breathing, appetite, and life and often used metonymically to refer to the entire body and the personality inhabiting it

H4288.def: = state in which objects are being broken or destroyed; ≈ often used figuratively to denote difficult circumstances

H5315.def: = the part of the body connecting the head to the rest of the body and containing the passageways for blood, air, and food; ≈ associated with breathing, appetite, and life and often used metonymically to refer to the entire body and the personality inhabiting it

H183.def: = state in which humans sense a physical craving for food or alcoholic drinks; this desire is associated with one's {L:נֶפֶשׁ<SDBH:נֶפֶשׁ>} ≈ and can be both good and evil

H369.def: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non-existant

H1878.def: = process by which the human body accumulates fat, ≈ which used to be regarded as the best part and associated with health and well-being

18.gl: to be made fat > to prosper

H6662.def: = state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior

H8130.def: = state in which humans or deities experience hostility towards a person, an object, or a practice

H8267.def: = state in which humans are not committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions

H7563.def: = state in which a person's behavior is inconsistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior

H887.def: = process by which objects such as dead animals, plants, or wounds give off a foul odor; ≈ considered repulsive

H2659.def: = action by which animals strike the ground with their feet

H6666.def: = something that one considers one's rightful due

H5341.def: = action by which humans or deities carefully observe an object or event for a longer period of time

H8537.def: literally: completeness; hence: = state in which humans are considered morally blameless, with profound moral uprightness and integrity

H1870.def: = an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives

H7564.def: = action by which humans act in a way that is contrary to (God's) law, ► resulting in a state of guilt

H369.def: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non-existant

H7326.def: = state in which an animal lacks what is essential for its normal needs

H7227.def: = state in which an object is very large in size

H1952.def: = a large quantity of valuable resources, ownership of which affects the way people think and live

H6239.def: = state in which humans possess an abundance of valuable goods, ≈ which is usually associated with a high status and considered a blessing from God

H5315.def: = the part of the body connecting the head to the rest of the body and containing the passageways for blood, air, and food; ≈ associated with breathing, appetite, and life and often used metonymically to refer to the entire body and the personality inhabiting it

H1606.def: = action by which humans or deities speak to animals, humans, deities, or natural objects in anger, in order to express their displeasure and cause them to change their behavior

H216.def: = light as a physical phenomenon, mainly observed during daytime, and the opposite of darkness; ◄ one of God's most important attributes; first created by God and since produced by sun, moon, and stars, but also by fire; ► enables people and animals to see; ≈ associated with life, goodness, happiness, prosperity, security, favor, and wisdom, loved by the righteous, and hated by the wicked

H6662.def: = state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior

H8055.def: = state in which humans and deities feel and show great joy

H7563.def: = state in which a person's behavior is inconsistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior

H1846.def: = process by which a fire or light is put out; ≈ associated with the beginning of difficult times, and sometimes even death

H2087.def: = state in which humans have an exalted status in their own eyes, resulting in a failure to see the limits of what is permitted or appropriate in view of one's status, and act accordingly; ≈ often associated with sin, disobedience, foolishness, aggression, and rebellion against God

H4683.def: = thin cracker-like bread made without yeast

H2451.def: = state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency

H854.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H3289.def: = action by which humans or deities exercise their minds to determine how they are going to achieve a particular purpose

H1892.def: = a slight movement of air; ≈ associated with something without substance, that quickly passes away

H1952.def: = a large quantity of valuable resources, ownership of which affects the way people think and live

H4591.def: = state in which humans or objects are relatively few in number

H6908.def: = action by which humans or animals come together as a group for a common purpose

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H8431.def: literally: waiting; hence: = state in which humans are confident that their longing will be fulfilled

H4900.def: = state in which humans are of more than average height{N:001}

H3820.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H2470.def: = process by which humans lose their physical strength ◄ as a result of sickness, injury, a prolonged exertion of strength, or other circumstances

H8378.def: = process by which someone senses a physical craving for food

H6086.def: = any kind of tall, woody plant that grows from a single trunk and with several lateral branches that often bear leaves and fruit

H936.def: = state in which someone considers someone or something else unworthy of attention or respect, and shows that by his/her actions

H3373.def: = state in which humans experience fear

H4687.def: = causative action by which humans or deities prescribe or instruct (other) humans or themselves how to behave or respond to a situation

H8451.def: = causative action by which humans or deities offer instruction to (other) humans, ► aimed to teach the recipients wisdom and good behavior

H2450.def: = state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency

H4726.def: = an opening in the earth that gives access to the subterranean water which either comes to the surface or can be drawn from it; ≈ its water is regarded as a source of life and well-being

H4170.def: = contraption; ► used for catching animals; ≈ associated with aggression and control

H4194.def: = process by which humans or animals stop living

H2580.def: = state in which someone or something is physically attractive; ► which may bring about a favorable attitude in others

H1870.def: = an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives

H898.def: = pattern of behavior by which humans act in a way which shows a lack of truthfulness and commitment, both in words and deeds

H386.def: = state of not being subject to change

H6175.def: = state in which someone is be able to manipulate difficult circumstances in such a way that the outcome is favorable to the planner; ≈ sometimes used in a positive sense, but also used in a negative sense

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

H1847.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H3684.def: = state of absence of wisdom, which manifests itself in excessive anger, talking too rashly and too much, sinful behavior, and laziness, ► and results in poverty, shame, punishment, and trouble and grief for other people; ≈ foolishness is thought to reside in a person's {L:heart<SDBH:לֵב>}; the behavior and treatment of fools is often compared to that of animals

H6566.def: = causative action by which humans spread out an object, such as a piece of cloth, a net, or a document either horizontally or vertically

H200.def: = state of being regarded as foolish, ◄  because of lack of fear of God, unwillingness to listen to advice, talking too much, and being unable to conceal one's temper

H7563.def: = state in which a person's behavior is inconsistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior

H4397.def: = a human or supernatural being who carries a message on behalf of someone else

H5307.def: = process by which humans, animals, or objects move from a higher level to a lower level, typically at a high speed and without control

H529.def: = state in which humans are considered worthy of trust, because they are truthful and committed, with an unwavering disposition, which is reflected in their actions

H6735.def: = a physical likeness or representation of a person, animal, or thing in the form of an image or a drawing; ► functioning in non-sanctioned rituals or as an object of non-sanctioned worship

H4832.def: = causative action by which humans or deities help or cause (other) humans to be restored to health or physical strength after a disease or an accident

H7389.def: = state in which humans lack sufficient means to live at a standard that is considered normal; ≈ sometimes associated with laziness or foolishness, but ultimately determined by God

H7036.def: = state which provokes disdain from the general public or from a specific category of people ◄ due to one's behavior or condition

H4148.def: = causative action by which deities offer primarily verbal instruction to humans, which may occasionally be accompanied by physical punishment, given as a result of misbehavior or to prevent misbehavior, ► aimed to teach the receiver (and sometimes other people as well) wisdom and good behavior

H8104.def: = action by which humans or deities carefully observe an object or event for a longer period of time

H3513.def: = state in which objects have relatively much weight, ≈ which is often associated with slowness, functioning with difficulty, but also with importance, riches, status, etc.

H8378.def: = process by which someone senses a physical craving for food

H6149.def: = action by which humans or deities take responsibility for someone else, taking upon themselves that person's obligations or vouching for that person's security

H5315.def: = the part of the body connecting the head to the rest of the body and containing the passageways for blood, air, and food; ≈ associated with breathing, appetite, and life and often used metonymically to refer to the entire body and the personality inhabiting it

H8441.def: = state in which an event is considered utterly wrong and detestable

H3684.def: = state of absence of wisdom, which manifests itself in excessive anger, talking too rashly and too much, sinful behavior, and laziness, ► and results in poverty, shame, punishment, and trouble and grief for other people; ≈ foolishness is thought to reside in a person's {L:heart<SDBH:לֵב>}; the behavior and treatment of fools is often compared to that of animals

H1980.def: = process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another

H7462.def: = action by which animals are feeding on grass and other edible materials in the field, ≈ often extended to denote the way a king cares for his subjects or the way God cares for his people

H3684.def: = state of absence of wisdom, which manifests itself in excessive anger, talking too rashly and too much, sinful behavior, and laziness, ► and results in poverty, shame, punishment, and trouble and grief for other people; ≈ foolishness is thought to reside in a person's {L:heart<SDBH:לֵב>}; the behavior and treatment of fools is often compared to that of animals

H7489.def: literally: to make (one's deeds) wrong; hence: = action by which humans behave in an evil or harmful way

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H7291.def: = action by which humans go behind (other) humans or animals, usually at an increased speed

H2400.def: = state in which a human being is responsible for a specified or implied offence, ► which results in a state of guilt which may require atonement, restitution, and retribution

H6662.def: = state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior

H6845.def: = action by which humans hide themselves ► in order to attack another person

H400.def: = any nutritious substance that people or animals eat or drink ► in order to maintain life and growth

H5215.def: = small container ◄ made out of earthenware, ► filled with {L:oil<SDBH:שֶׁמֶן>} and with a {L:wick<SDBH:פִּשְׁתָּה>} placed in it; sometimes placed on a {L:lampstand<SDBH:מְנֹורָה>}; used as a source of {L:light<SDBH:אֹור>}; ≈ associated with peace, stability and well-being

H2820.def: = causative action by which human or deities keep something to themselves, refusing to give it to someone else

H7626.def: = stick ◄ usually made of wood; ► attribute of a shepherd or a ruler, but also used for other purposes, such as beating, walking, fighting, etc.; ≈ associated with shepherding, authority, punishment

H7648.def: = process by which someone's desire for food is fulfilled

H990.def: = front part of the human trunk below the ribs, containing the stomach, bowels, and reproductive organs; ≈ associated with birth, food, speech, and the innermost part of objects
